questions.question: When using Infrastructure as a Service (laaS), what is the key benefit provided to the Customer?
options: The Cost of Ownership is transferred
[]The ability to scale up infrastructure services based on projected usage
Increased energy and cooling system efficiency
Usage is metered and priced on the basis of units consumed

options: Shifting from IT investment as capital expenditures to operational expenditures
The time savings and efficiencies offered by the cloud service
[]Branding associated with the cloud provider that might be selected

questions.question: When should cloud providers allow Platform as a Service (PaaS) customers shell access to the servers running their instances?
options: Only when the contract stipulates that requirement

questions.question: From a customer perspective, all of the following are benefits of Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) cloud services except...
options: []Reduced cost of administering the OS in the cloud environment

questions.question: @`wotf is a unique benefit of a private cloud versus other deployment models?

Which cloud hosting model would be the most appropriate for a company looking to leverage multiple cloud providers for disaster recovery or load bursts?
How does Elasticity differ from Scalability?
options: Scalability differs in its ability to not only scale-out but to shrink back down resources based on-demand as well.
[]Elasticity differs in its ability to not only scale-out but to shrink back down resources based on-demand as well.
Elasticity is the ability to be available from many locations.

questions.question: @`wotf best describes server virtualization?
options: Consolidation of data from multiple sources into a single virtual data store
[]Logically partitioning physical compute and storage devices into multiple smaller virtual devices
Aggregating physical resources spread over multiple physical devices into a single virtual device
Abstracting the complexity of physical infrastructure behind a simple web

questions.question:
An administrator has configured an alarm to be notified when a virtual machine meets either of these conditions:
  • High virtual CPU
  • High active memory consumption

The alarm is only triggering when both of the conditions are met. What can be done to correct the alarm behavior?
options: []Edit the alarm and select Trigger if ANY of the following conditions are met
Edit the alarm and select Trigger if ALL of the following conditions are met
Create two separate alarms, one for CPU and one for memory and link them together with ESXCLI
Delete the existing alarm and create a new event-based alarm

questions.question: An administrator is monitoring a High Availability (HA) and Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) enabled cluster and has noticed that virtual machines in the cluster are being migrated without user intervention. Why is this happening?
options: []The DRS Automation level is set to Fully Automated
The Automation level is set to Automatic
The DPM Threshold is set to Aggressive
The Power Management feature is configured

questions.question: Some of the VMs in a vSphere DRS cluster are not being migrated as expected. Which two factors can affect DRS behavior?
options: The currently configured TPS settings for the VMs
The currently configured Enhanced vMotion Compatibility level for the cluster

questions.question: @`wotf are Admission Control settings of a VMware vSphere HA cluster?
options: []Define failover capacity by static number of hosts
